byline.original: By William Stockton; William Stockton, editor of the Sunday Business section of The Times, frequently writes about fitness

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: NOT LONG AGO, A MIDDLE-AGED friend with a bit of a bohemian streak stopped sleeping on a mattress on the floor and bought a regular bed. The reason: when he woke up in the morning his stiff and creaky joints had begun to make it difficult for him to get up off the floor. Now sleeping in a normal bed gave him a 20-inch head start.
